Message.Title: Doji cross on the weekly chart is bad news
Message.Msg: This double top at 245-247 with a doji cross on this weeks weekly chart is possibly a big sell signal. The doji signals the bulls are losing steam here and the bears are gaining. This stock is topping here.

"Didn't you say earlier you were waiting for $238? So you expect the stock to go lower." I did, but what I meant was that it would be great if AMZN went down to 238 or so, so that I would be able to buy calls cheap. Not really expecting her to go down below 240. She looks ready to start creep up again. Yes, I sold those calls yesterday above $1.00.
not bad

Message.Title: 2 things to crash Amazon sales/eranings/loyalty/traffic in short to medium term
Message.Msg: Sale tax being charged in many more states over the next year in which Amazon previously offered tax free shopping. Amazon just rescinded their initial 20 GB free cloud storage and reverted everyone to 5 GB free cloud storage, saying content in excess of that that had been stored would be unavailable, and that an annual fee must be paid to get more storage. 2 Whammys from Amazon hitting their customers simultaneously right as they head into the important holiday shopping season.

They have covered for losses whopping around the new high and are now quietly hiding somewhere "refocusing" their "algorithms" so they can lose even more money, and then cry about how rigged it all it is, and unfair, etc.
This joker kept bragging about how he had shorted the old high. So he rode it down and rode it back up losing most of his gains before covering for small measly gain. Great momo trading!

You guys lack the capability to fear the price moving higher. You guys short AMZN because you've seen her plunge spectacularly a few times, dreaming of making lots of money quick, only to find that the stock starts to move upward right after you short, forcing you to "declare" that you're a long-term "investor," not a gung ho trader. Your brokers will pull the plug for you eventually. That's how things end for you shorts around here.

Message.Title: Geegee, fyi shorts tend to be more disciplined and therby better traderz then most
Message.Msg: As a general rule most shorts have at onetime or another been put through the fire to be at the advanced level of a margin account... As a general rule shorts are aware of risk and control it so they dont need to worry about volitility on a daily weekly or monthly basis... As a general rule shorts dont go 'out of business' the same way as an irrational long will with a newly minted margin account... You are a fool to underestimate short traderz and/or their ability to perservere by way of controling risk.... But that isnt really a surprise to anyone that reads your follish gibberish.
